citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in tetrahydrobiopterin biosynthesis. Seems to both prevent the formation of 7-pterins and accelerate the formation of quinonoid-BH2. May also have a positive regulatory role in the expression of phhA
(6R)-6-(L-erythro-1,2-dihydroxypropyl)-5,6,7,8-tetrahydro-4a-hydroxypterin = (6R)-6-(L-erythro-1,2-dihydroxypropyl)-7,8-dihydro-6H-pterin + H(2)O
Belongs to the pterin-4-alpha-carbinolamine dehydratase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the methyl esterification of L-isoaspartyl residues in peptides and proteins that result from spontaneous decomposition of normal L-aspartyl and L-asparaginyl residues. It plays a role in the repair and/or degradation of damaged proteins
S-adenosyl-L-methionine + protein L-isoaspartate = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + protein L-isoaspartate alpha-methyl ester
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the L-isoaspartyl/D-aspartyl protein methyltransferase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Acyl-CoA + sn-glycerol 3-phosphate = CoA + 1-acyl-sn-glycerol 3-phosphate
De novo phospholipid biosynthesis; first step
Membrane-bound
The HXXXXD motif is essential for acyltransferase activity and may constitute the binding site for the phosphate moiety of the glycerol-3-phosphate
Belongs to the GPAT/DAPAT family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Not known, probably involved in fatty acid or phospholipid synthesis
Belongs to the plsX family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Nicotinate D-ribonucleotide + diphosphate = nicotinate + 5-phospho-alpha-D-ribose 1-diphosphate
NAD biosynthesis; nicotinamide to NaMN; second step
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the NAPRTase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the reversible transfer of the terminal phosphate of ATP to form a long-chain polyphosphate (polyP)
ATP + (phosphate)(n) = ADP + (phosphate)(n+1)
An intermediate of this reaction is the autophosphorylated ppk in which a phosphate is covalently linked to histidine residues through a N-P bond
Belongs to the polyphosphate kinase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the phosphorylation of NAD to NADP. Utilizes ATP and other nucleoside triphosphates as well as inorganic polyphosphate as a source of phosphorus
ATP + NAD(+) = ADP + NADP(+)
Divalent metal ions
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the NAD kinase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Required for coenzyme pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis. PQQ is probably formed by crosslinking a specific glutamate to a specific tyrosine residue and excising these residues from the peptide
Pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis
Belongs to the pqqA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: May be involved in the transport of PQQ or its precursor to the periplasm
Pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis
Belongs to the pqqB family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Ring cyclization and eight-electron oxidation of 3a-(2-amino-2-carboxyethyl)-4,5-dioxo-4,5,6,7,8,9-hexahydroquinoline-7,9-dicarboxylic-acid to PQQ

6-(2-amino-2-carboxyethyl)-7,8-dioxo-1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8-octahydroquinoline-2,4-dicarboxylate + 3 O(2) = 4,5-dioxo-3a,4,5,6,7,8,9,9b-octahydro-1H-pyrrolo[2,3-f]quinoline-2,7,9-tricarboxylate + 2 H(2)O(2) + 2 H(2)O
Pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis
Belongs to the pqqC family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis
Belongs to the pqqD family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis
Belongs to the pqqD family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds 1 4Fe-4S cluster coordinated with 3 cysteines and an exchangeable S-adenosyl-L-methionine
Pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis
Belongs to the radical SAM superfamily. PqqE family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Required for coenzyme pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis. It is thought that this protein is a protease that cleaves peptides bond in a small peptide (gene pqqA), providing the glutamate and tyrosine residues which are necessary for the synthesis of PQQ
Binds 1 zinc ion per subunit
Pyrroloquinoline quinone (PQQ) biosynthesis
Belongs to the peptidase M16 family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: DNA primase is the polymerase that synthesizes small RNA primers for the Okazaki fragments on both template strands at replication forks during chromosomal DNA synthesis
Binds 1 zinc ion per molecule
Monomer

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Methylates ribosomal protein L11
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the methyltransferase superfamily. PrmA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the NADPH dependent reduction of L-gamma-glutamyl 5-phosphate into L-glutamate 5-semialdehyde and phosphate. The product spontaneously undergoes cyclization to form 1-pyrroline-5-carboxylate
L-glutamate 5-semialdehyde + phosphate + NADP(+) = L-glutamyl 5-phosphate + NADPH
Proline biosynthesis; second step
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the gamma-glutamyl phosphate reductase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the transfer of a phosphate group to glutamate to form glutamate 5-phosphate which rapidly cyclizes to 5-oxoproline
ATP + L-glutamate = ADP + L-glutamate 5-phosphate
Proline biosynthesis; first step
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the glutamate 5-kinase family
Contains 1 PUA domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Phosphatidyl-L-serine = phosphatidylethanolamine + CO(2)
Pyruvoyl group
Belongs to the phosphatidylserine decarboxylase family. Type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex pstSACB involved in phosphate import. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + phosphate(Out) = ADP + phosphate + phosphate(In)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (pstB), two transmembrane proteins (pstC and pstA) and a solute-binding protein (pstS)
Inner membrane-associated
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Phosphate importer (TC 3.A.1.7) subfamily
Contains 1 ABC transporter domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Part of the ABC transporter complex pstSACB involved in phosphate import. Responsible for energy coupling to the transport system
ATP + H(2)O + phosphate(Out) = ADP + phosphate + phosphate(In)
The complex is composed of two ATP-binding proteins (pstB), two transmembrane proteins (pstC and pstA) and a solute-binding protein (pstS)
Inner membrane-associated
Belongs to the ABC transporter family. Phosphate importer (TC 3.A.1.7) subfamily
Contains 1 ABC transporter domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The natural substrate for this enzyme may be peptidyl-tRNAs which drop off the ribosome during protein synthesis
N-substituted aminoacyl-tRNA + H(2)O = N-substituted amino acid + tRNA
Monomer
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the PTH family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + 5-phospho-D-ribosylamine + glycine = ADP + phosphate + N(1)-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)glycinamide
Nucleotide biosynthesis; IMP biosynthesis; N(1)-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)glycinamide from 5-phospho-alpha-D-ribose 1-diphosphate: step 2
Context: Purine biosynthesis
Belongs to the GARS family
Contains 1 ATP-grasp domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + N(2)-formyl-N(1)-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)glycinamide + L-glutamine + H(2)O = ADP + phosphate + 2-(formamido)-N(1)-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)acetamidine + L-glutamate
Nucleotide biosynthesis; IMP biosynthesis; 5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide from N(2)-formyl-N(1)-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)glycinamide: step 1
Context: Purine biosynthesis
Monomer
Cytoplasm
In the N-terminal section; belongs to the FGAMS family
Contains 1 type-1 glutamine amidotransferase domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + 2-(formamido)-N(1)-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)acetamidine = ADP + phosphate + 5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole
Nucleotide biosynthesis; IMP biosynthesis; 5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide from N(2)-formyl-N(1)-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)glycinamide: step 2
Context: Purine biosynthesis
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the AIR synthase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: ATP + 5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxylate + L-aspartate = ADP + phosphate + (S)-2-(5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamido)succinate
Nucleotide biosynthesis; IMP biosynthesis; 5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide from N(2)-formyl-N(1)-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)glycinamide: step 4
Context: Purine biosynthesis
Belongs to the SAICAR synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: 10-formyltetrahydrofolate + 5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide = tetrahydrofolate + 5-formamido-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide
IMP + H(2)O = 5-formamido-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide
Nucleotide biosynthesis; IMP biosynthesis; 5-formamido-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide from 5-amino-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide (10-formyl THF route): single step
Nucleotide biosynthesis; IMP biosynthesis; IMP from 5-formamido-1-(5-phospho-D-ribosyl)imidazole-4-carboxamide: single step [final step]
Context: Purine biosynthesis
The IMP cyclohydrolase activity resides in the N-terminal region
Belongs to the purH family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Plays an important role in the de novo pathway of purine nucleotide biosynthesis
GTP + IMP + L-aspartate = GDP + phosphate + N(6)-(1,2-dicarboxyethyl)-AMP
Binds 1 magnesium ion per subunit
AMP biosynthesis; first committed step
Homodimer
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the adenylosuccinate synthetase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Carbamoyl phosphate + L-aspartate = phosphate + N-carbamoyl-L-aspartate
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 2
Context: Pyrimidine biosynthesis
Belongs to the ATCase/OTCase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: (S)-dihydroorotate + H(2)O = N-carbamoyl-L-aspartate
Binds 2 zinc ions per subunit
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 3
Context: Pyrimidine biosynthesis
Homodimer
Belongs to the DHOase family. Type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: (S)-dihydroorotate + O(2) = orotate + H(2)O(2)
Binds 1 FMN per subunit
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 4
Context: Pyrimidine biosynthesis
Homodimer
Inner side of the membrane
Belongs to the dihydroorotate dehydrogenase family. Type 2 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Orotidine 5'-phosphate + diphosphate = orotate + 5-phospho-alpha-D-ribose 1-diphosphate
Magnesium
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 5
Context: Pyrimidine biosynthesis
Homodimer
Belongs to the purine/pyrimidine phosphoribosyltransferase family. PyrE subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Orotidine 5'-phosphate = UMP + CO(2)
Nucleotide biosynthesis; UMP biosynthesis; UMP from HCO(3)(-): step 6 [final step]
Context: Pyrimidine biosynthesis
Homodimer
Belongs to the OMP decarboxylase family. Type 1 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the ATP-dependent amination of UTP to CTP with either L-glutamine or ammonia as the source of nitrogen
ATP + UTP + NH(3) = ADP + phosphate + CTP
Allosterically activated by GTP, when glutamine is the substrate. Inhibited by CTP
Pyrimidine biosynthesis; conversion of UMP to CTP; third (last) step
Homotetramer
Belongs to the CTP synthase family
Contains 1 type-1 glutamine amidotransferase domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the phosphorylation of UMP to UDP
ATP + UMP = ADP + UDP
Pyrimidine biosynthesis; conversion of UMP to CTP; first step
Belongs to the UMP kinase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the oxidative deamination of a wide range of aliphatic and aromatic amines
RCH(2)NH(2) + H(2)O + acceptor = RCHO + NH(3) + reduced acceptor
CTQ
Heterotrimer of an alpha, a beta and a gamma subunit
Periplasmic
The cysteine tryptophylquinone (CTQ) is generated by oxidation of the indole ring of a tryptophan residue to form tryptophylquinone, followed by covalent cross-linking with a cysteine residue
Met-29 is oxidized to methionine sulfoxide, probably during sample preparation
Is propably co-translocated into the periplasm when associated with the alpha and/or beta subunit, which contain both a signal peptide
The natural electron acceptor is the blue copper protein azurin

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Synthesizes oQ from preQ1 in a single S-adenosylmethionine-requiring step. The ribosyl moiety of AdoMet is transferred and isomerized to the epoxycyclopentane residue of oQ
Queuosine biosynthesis
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the queA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the NADPH-dependent reduction of 7-cyano-7-deazaguanine (preQ0) to 7-aminomethyl-7-deazaguanine (preQ1)
Queuosine biosynthesis; Q-tRNA from preQ0; step 1
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the GTP cyclohydrolase I family. QueF type 2 subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in DNA repair
Belongs to the radC family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Transcription regulator that activates transcription by stimulating RNA polymerase (RNAP) recycling in case of stress conditions such as supercoiled DNA or high salt concentrations. Probably acts by releasing the RNAP, when it is trapped or immobilized on tightly supercoiled DNA. Does not activate transcription on linear DNA. Probably not involved in DNA repair
Interacts with the RNAP. Has a higher affinity for the core RNAP than for the holoenzyme. Its ATPase activity is stimulated by binding to RNAP
Belongs to the SNF2/RAD54 helicase family. RapA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Associates with free 30S ribosomal subunits (but not with 30S subunits that are part of 70S ribosomes or polysomes). Essential for efficient processing of 16S rRNA. May interact with the 5'terminal helix region of 16S rRNA
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the rbfA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Not known; may be involved in recombination
Seems to be associated with the nucleoid
Belongs to the rdgC family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Can catalyze the hydrolysis of ATP in the presence of single-stranded DNA, the ATP-dependent uptake of single-stranded DNA by duplex DNA, and the ATP-dependent hybridization of homologous single-stranded DNAs. It interacts with lexA causing its activation and leading to its autocatalytic cleavage
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the recA family

protein.name: DNA replication and repair protein recF

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The recF protein is involved in DNA metabolism; it is required for DNA replication and normal SOS inducibility. RecF binds preferentially to single-stranded, linear DNA. It also seems to bind ATP
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the recF family

feature.description: DNA replication and repair protein recF

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in DNA repair and recF pathway recombination
Belongs to the recO family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: May play a role in DNA repair. It seems to be involved in an recBC-independent recombinational process of DNA repair. It may act with recF and recO
Belongs to the recR family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Modulates recA activity
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the recX family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Peptide chain release factor 1 directs the termination of translation in response to the peptide chain termination codons UAG and UAA
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the prokaryotic/mitochondrial release factor family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Increases the formation of ribosomal termination complexes and stimulates activities of RF-1 and RF-2. It binds guanine nucleotides and has strong preference for UGA stop codons. It may interact directly with the ribosome. The stimulation of RF-1 and RF-2 is significantly reduced by GTP and GDP, but not by GMP
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the GTP-binding elongation factor family. PrfC subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Can carry out ATP-dependent unwinding of double stranded RNA. Has a role in RNA decay. Involved in the RNA degradosome, a multi-enzyme complex important in RNA processing and messenger RNA degradation
Component of the degradosome complex
Belongs to the DEAD box helicase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Riboflavin biosynthesis
Belongs to the DHBP synthase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Responsible for the addition of glutamate residues to the C-terminus of ribosomal protein S6
Binds 2 manganese ions per subunit
Belongs to the rimK family
Contains 1 ATP-grasp domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Essential for efficient processing of 16S rRNA. Probably part of the 30S subunit prior to or during the final step in the processing of 16S free 30S ribosomal subunits. It could be some accessory protein needed for efficient assembly of the 30S subunit. It is needed in a step prior to rbfA during the maturation of 16S rRNA. It has affinity for free ribosomal 30S subunits but not for 70S ribosomes
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the rimM family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Riboflavin synthase is a bifunctional enzyme complex catalyzing the formation of riboflavin from 5-amino-6-(1'-D)-ribityl-amino-2,4(1H,3H)-pyrimidinedione and L-3,4-dihydrohy-2-butanone-4-phosphate via 6,7-dimethyl-8-lumazine. The beta subunit catalyzes the condensation of 5-amino-6-(1'-D)-ribityl-amino-2,4(1H,3H)-pyrimidinedione with L-3,4-dihydrohy-2-butanone-4-phosphate yielding 6,7-dimethyl-8-lumazine
2 6,7-dimethyl-8-(1-D-ribityl)lumazine = riboflavin + 4-(1-D-ribitylamino)-5-amino-2,6-dihydroxypyrimidine
Riboflavin biosynthesis; last step
Belongs to the DMRL synthase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L10P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein binds directly to 23S ribosomal RNA
One or more lysine residues are methylated
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L11P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds to the 23S rRNA
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L15P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds 23S rRNA and is also seen to make contacts with the A and possibly P site tRNAs
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L16P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This is one of the proteins that binds and probably mediates the attachment of the 5S RNA into the large ribosomal subunit, where it forms part of the central protuberance
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit; part of the 5S rRNA/L5/L18/L25 subcomplex. Contacts the 5S and 23S rRNAs
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L18P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein is located at the 30S-50S ribosomal subunit interface and may play a role in the structure and function of the aminoacyl-tRNA binding site
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L19P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein binds directly to 23S rRNA and is located in the neighborhood of the site where elongation factor Tu is bound to the ribosome
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L1P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein binds directly to 23S ribosomal RNA and is necessary for the in vitro assembly process of the 50S ribosomal subunit. It is not involved in the protein synthesizing functions of that subunit
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L20P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This protein binds specifically to 23S rRNA; its binding is stimulated by other ribosomal proteins, e.g., L4, L17, and L20. It is important during the early stages of 50S assembly. It makes multiple contacts with different domains of the 23S rRNA in the assembled 50S subunit and ribosome

The globular domain of the protein is located near the polypeptide exit tunnel on the outside of the subunit, while an extended beta-hairpin is found that lines the wall of the exit tunnel in the center of the 70S ribosome
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L22P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of two assembly inititator proteins, it binds directly to the 5' end of the 23S rRNA, where it nucleates assembly of the 50S subunit
One of the proteins that surrounds the polypeptide exit tunnel on the outside of the subunit
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L24P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This is one of the proteins that binds to the 5S RNA in the ribosome where it forms part of the central protuberance
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit; part of the 5S rRNA/L5/L18/L25 subcomplex. Contacts the 5S rRNA. Binds to the 5S rRNA independently of L5 and L18
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L25P family. Ctc subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L27P family

citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L28P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L29P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the primary rRNA binding proteins. Required for association of the 30S and 50S subunits to form the 70S ribosome, for tRNA binding and peptide bond formation. It has been suggested to have peptidyltransferase activity; this is somewhat controversial. Makes several contacts with the 16S rRNA in the 70S ribosome
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit. Forms a bridge to the 30S subunit in the 70S ribosome
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L2P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds the 23S rRNA
Binds 1 zinc ion per subunit
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L31P family. Type A subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L32P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L33P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L34P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L35P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein L36P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the primary rRNA binding proteins, it binds directly near the 3' end of the 23S rRNA, where it nucleates assembly of the 50S subunit
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit. Forms a cluster with proteins L14 and L19
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L3P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the primary rRNA binding proteins, this protein initially binds near the 5' end of the 23S rRNA. It is important during the early stages of 50S assembly. It makes multiple contacts with different domains of the 23S rRNA in the assembled 50S subunit and ribosome
Forms part of the polypeptide exit tunnel
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L4P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This is 1 of the proteins that binds and probably mediates the attachment of the 5S RNA into the large ribosomal subunit, where it forms part of the central protuberance. In the 70S ribosome it contacts protein S13 of the 30S subunit (bridge B1b), connecting the 2 subunits; this bridge is implicated in subunit movement. Contacts the P site tRNA; the 5S rRNA and some of its associated proteins might help stabilize positioning of ribosome-bound tRNAs
Part of the 50S ribosomal subunit; part of the 5S rRNA/L5/L18/L25 subcomplex. Contacts the 5S rRNA and the P site tRNA. Forms a bridge to the 30S subunit in the 70S ribosome
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L5P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Seems to be the binding site for several of the factors involved in protein synthesis and appears to be essential for accurate translation
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L12P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds to the 23S rRNA
Belongs to the ribosomal protein L9P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Specifically methylates the ribose of guanosine 2251 in 23S rRNA
Belongs to the RNA methyltransferase trmH family

feature.description: S-adenosyl-L-methionine (via amide nitrogen and carbonyl oxygen)

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Digests double-stranded RNA. Involved in the processing of ribosomal RNA precursors and of some mRNAs
Endonucleolytic cleavage to 5'-phosphomonoester
Cytoplasm
Contains 1 DRBM (double-stranded RNA-binding) domain
Contains 1 RNase III domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Endonuclease that specifically degrades the RNA of RNA-DNA hybrids
Endonucleolytic cleavage to 5'-phosphomonoester
Manganese or magnesium. Binds 1 divalent metal ion per monomer in the absence of substrate. May bind a second metal ion after substrate binding
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the RNase HII family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Endonuclease that specifically degrades the RNA of RNA-DNA hybrids
Endonucleolytic cleavage to 5'-phosphomonoester
Binds 1 magnesium ion per subunit. May bind a second metal ion at a regulatory site, or after substrate binding
Monomer
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the RNase H family
Contains 1 RNase H domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: RNaseP catalyzes the removal of the 5'-leader sequence from pre-tRNA to produce the mature 5'terminus. It can also cleave other RNA substrates such as 4.5S RNA. The protein component plays an auxiliary but essential role in vivo by binding to the 5'-leader sequence and broadening the substrate specificity of the ribozyme
Endonucleolytic cleavage of RNA, removing 5'-extranucleotides from tRNA precursor
Consists of a catalytic RNA component (M1 or rnpB) and a protein subunit
Belongs to the rnpA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Phosphorolytic exoribonuclease that removes nucleotide residues following the -CCA terminus of tRNA and adds nucleotides to the ends of RNA molecules by using nucleoside diphosphates as substrates
tRNA(n+1) + phosphate = tRNA(n) + a nucleoside diphosphate
Belongs to the RNase PH family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Responsible for the end-turnover of tRNA: specifically removes the terminal AMP residue from uncharged tRNA (tRNA-C-C-A). Also appears to be involved in tRNA biosynthesis
Belongs to the RNase T family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Zinc phosphodiesterase, which displays some tRNA 3'-processing endonuclease activity. Probably involved in tRNA maturation, by removing a 3'trailer from precursor tRNA

Endonucleolytic cleavage of RNA, removing extra 3' nucleotides from tRNA precursor, generating 3' termini of tRNAs. A 3'-hydroxy group is left at the tRNA terminus and a 5'-phosphoryl group is left at the trailer molecule
Binds 2 zinc ions
Homodimer
Belongs to the RNase Z family

citation.name: Nucleic Acids Res.
citation.title: Nucleotide and deduced amino acid sequence of the RpoN sigma-factor of Pseudomonas putida.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Sigma factors are initiation factors that promote the attachment of RNA polymerase to specific initiation sites and are then released. This sigma factor is responsible for the expression of the xylCAB operon and the xylS gene. The open complex (sigma-54 and core RNA polymerase) serves as the receptor for receipt of the melting signal from the remotely bound activator protein xylR for the expression of the xylCAB operon and xylS
Belongs to the sigma-54 factor family

citation.name: Nucleic Acids Res.
citation.title: Nucleotide and deduced amino acid sequence of the RpoN sigma-factor of Pseudomonas putida.

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Probably modulates the activity of sigma(54) (rpoN)
Belongs to the sigma(54) modulation protein family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: D-ribose 5-phosphate = D-ribulose 5-phosphate
Carbohydrate degradation; pentose phosphate pathway
Belongs to the ribose 5-phosphate isomerase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates
Nucleoside triphosphate + RNA(n) = diphosphate + RNA(n+1)
Homodimer. The RNAP catalytic core consists of 2 alpha, 1 beta, 1 beta' and 1 omega subunit. When a sigma factor is associated with the core the holoenzyme is formed, which can initiate transcription

The N-terminal domain is essential for RNAP assembly and basal transcription, whereas the C-terminal domain is involved in interaction with transcriptional regulators and with upstream promoter elements
Belongs to the RNA polymerase alpha chain family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates
Nucleoside triphosphate + RNA(n) = diphosphate + RNA(n+1)
The RNAP catalytic core consists of 2 alpha, 1 beta, 1 beta' and 1 omega subunit. When a sigma factor is associated with the core the holoenzyme is formed, which can initiate transcription
Belongs to the RNA polymerase beta chain family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyzes the transcription of DNA into RNA using the four ribonucleoside triphosphates as substrates
Nucleoside triphosphate + RNA(n) = diphosphate + RNA(n+1)
The RNAP catalytic core consists of 2 alpha, 1 beta, 1 beta' and 1 omega subunit. When a sigma factor is associated with the core the holoenzyme is formed, which can initiate transcription
Belongs to the RNA polymerase beta' chain family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Promotes RNA polymerase assembly. Latches the N- and C-terminal regions of the beta' subunit thereby facilitating its interaction with the beta and alpha subunits
Nucleoside triphosphate + RNA(n) = diphosphate + RNA(n+1)
The RNAP catalytic core consists of 2 alpha, 1 beta, 1 beta' and 1 omega subunit. When a sigma factor is associated with the core the holoenzyme is formed, which can initiate transcription
Belongs to the RNA polymerase omega chain family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Regulator of RNase E/rne, which inhibits the endonuclease activity and thereby leads to increase the half-life and abundance of RNAs. General modulator of RNA abundance. Does not have any methyltransferase activity
Homotrimer. Interacts with RNase E protein and probably inhibits its catalytic activity
Belongs to the rraA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Responsible for the release of ribosomes from messenger RNA at the termination of protein biosynthesis. May increase the efficiency of translation by recycling ribosomes from one round of translation to another
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the RRF family

protein.name: Ribosomal RNA large subunit methyltransferase J
rRNA (uridine-2'-O-)-methyltransferase
23S rRNA m2U2552 methyltransferase

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Specifically methylates the uridine in position 2552 of 23S rRNA in the fully assembled 50S ribosomal subunit
S-adenosyl-L-methionine + rRNA = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + rRNA containing 2'-O-methyluridine
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the methyltransferase superfamily. RrmJ family

feature.description: Ribosomal RNA large subunit methyltransferase J

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in the binding of tRNA to the ribosomes
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S10P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Located on the platform of the 30S subunit, it bridges several disparate RNA helices of the 16S rRNA. Forms part of the Shine-Dalgarno cleft in the 70S ribosome
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Interacts with proteins S7 and S18. Binds to IF-3
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S11P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: With S4 and S5 plays an important role in translational accuracy

Interacts with and stabilizes bases of the 16S rRNA that are involved in tRNA selection in the A site and with the mRNA backbone. Located at the interface of the 30S and 50S subunits, it traverses the body of the 30S subunit contacting proteins on the other side and probably holding the rRNA structure together. The combined cluster of proteins S8, S12 and S17 appears to hold together the shoulder and platform of the 30S subunit
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Contacts proteins S8 and S17. May interact with IF1 in the 30S initiation complex
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S12P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Located at the top of the head of the 30S subunit, it contacts several helices of the 16S rRNA. In the 70S ribosome it contacts the 23S rRNA (bridge B1a) and protein L5 of the 50S subunit (bridge B1b), connecting the 2 subunits; these bridges are implicated in subunit movement. Contacts the tRNAs in the A and P-sites
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Forms a loose heterodimer with protein S19. Forms two bridges to the 50S subunit in the 70S ribosome
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S13P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the primary rRNA binding proteins, it binds directly to 16S rRNA where it helps nucleate assembly of the platform of the 30S subunit by binding and bridging several RNA helices of the 16S rRNA
Forms an intersubunit bridge (bridge B4) with the 23S rRNA of the 50S subunit in the ribosome
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Forms a bridge to the 50S subunit in the 70S ribosome, contacting the 23S rRNA
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S15P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein S16P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds as a heterodimer with protein S6 to the central domain of the 16S rRNA, where it helps stabilize the platform of the 30S subunit
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Forms a tight heterodimer with protein S6
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S18P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Protein S19 forms a complex with S13 that binds strongly to the 16S ribosomal RNA
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S19P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds directly to 16S ribosomal RNA
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S20P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein S21P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein S2P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds the lower part of the 30S subunit head. Binds mRNA in the 70S ribosome, positioning it for translation
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Forms a tight complex with proteins S10 and S14
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S3P family
Contains 1 KH type-2 domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the primary rRNA binding proteins, it binds directly to 16S rRNA where it nucleates assembly of the body of the 30S subunit
With S5 and S12 plays an important role in translational accuracy
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Contacts protein S5. The interaction surface between S4 and S5 is involved in control of translational fidelity
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S4P family
Contains 1 S4 RNA-binding domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: With S4 and S12 plays an important role in translational accuracy
Located at the back of the 30S subunit body where it stabilizes the conformation of the head with respect to the body
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Contacts proteins S4 and S8

The N-terminal domain interacts with the head of the 30S subunit; the C-terminal domain interacts with the body and contacts protein S4. The interaction surface between S4 and S5 is involved in control of translational fidelity
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S5P family
Contains 1 S5 DRBM domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds together with S18 to 16S ribosomal RNA
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S6P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the primary rRNA binding proteins, it binds directly to 16S rRNA where it nucleates assembly of the head domain of the 30S subunit. Is located at the subunit interface close to the decoding center, probably blocks exit of the E-site tRNA
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Contacts proteins S9 and S11
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S7P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: One of the primary rRNA binding proteins, it binds directly to 16S rRNA central domain where it helps coordinate assembly of the platform of the 30S subunit
Part of the 30S ribosomal subunit. Contacts proteins S5 and S12
Belongs to the ribosomal protein S8P family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the ribosomal protein S9P family

protein.name: Ribosomal RNA small subunit methyltransferase B
rRNA (cytosine-C(5)-)-methyltransferase
16S rRNA m5C967 methyltransferase

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Specifically methylates the cytosine at position 967 (m5C967) of 16S rRNA
S-adenosyl-L-methionine + rRNA = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + rRNA containing C(5)-methylcytosine
Belongs to the methyltransferase superfamily. RsmB/NOP family

feature.description: Ribosomal RNA small subunit methyltransferase B

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the formation of 5-methyl-uridine at position 1939 (M-5-U1939) in 23S rRNA
S-adenosyl-L-methionine + rRNA = S-adenosyl-L-homocysteine + rRNA containing thymine
Belongs to the RNA M5U methyltransferase family. RumA subfamily
Contains 1 TRAM domain

protein.name: Holliday junction ATP-dependent DNA helicase ruvA

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The ruvA-ruvB complex in the presence of ATP renatures cruciform structure in supercoiled DNA with palindromic sequence, indicating that it may promote strand exchange reactions in homologous recombination. RuvAB is an helicase that mediates the Holliday junction migration by localized denaturation and reannealing. RuvA stimulates, in the presence of DNA, the weak ATPase activity of ruvB
Forms a complex with ruvB
Belongs to the ruvA family

feature.description: Holliday junction ATP-dependent DNA helicase ruvA

protein.name: Holliday junction ATP-dependent DNA helicase ruvB

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: The ruvA-ruvB complex in the presence of ATP renatures cruciform structure in supercoiled DNA with palindromic sequence, indicating that it may promote strand exchange reactions in homologous recombination. RuvAB is an helicase that mediates the Holliday junction migration by localized denaturation and reannealing
Forms a complex with ruvA
Belongs to the ruvB family

feature.description: Holliday junction ATP-dependent DNA helicase ruvB

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Nuclease that resolves Holliday junction intermediates in genetic recombination. Cleaves the cruciform structure in supercoiled DNA by nicking to strands with the same polarity at sites symmetrically opposed at the junction in the homologous arms and leaves a 5'terminal phosphate and a 3'terminal hydroxyl group
Endonucleolytic cleavage at a junction such as a reciprocal single-stranded crossover between two homologous DNA duplexes (Holliday junction)
Binds 1 magnesium ion per subunit
Belongs to the ruvC family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Could be a nuclease that resolves Holliday junction intermediates in genetic recombination
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the yqgF HJR family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: This is one of the proteins required for the normal export of envelope proteins out of the cell cytoplasm. It is a molecular chaperone that binds to a subset of precursor proteins, thereby preventing them from aggregating
Homotetramer. Interacts with secA. Part of the prokaryotic protein translocation apparatus which comprise secA, secB, secD, secE, secF, secG and secY
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the secB family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Converts seryl-tRNA(Sec UCA) to selenocysteinyl-tRNA(Sec UCA) during selenoprotein biosynthesis
L-seryl-tRNA(Sec) + selenophosphate = L-selenocysteinyl-tRNA(Sec) + H(2)O + phosphate
Pyridoxal phosphate
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the selA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Synthesizes selenophosphate from selenide and ATP
ATP + selenide + H(2)O = AMP + selenophosphate + phosphate
Magnesium
Belongs to the selenophosphate synthetase 1 family. Class I subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the transfer of selenium from selenophosphate for conversion of 2-thiouridine to 2-selenouridine at the wobble position in tRNA
5-methylaminomethyl-2-thiouridine + selenophosphate = 5-methylaminomethyl-2-selenouridine + phosphate
Monomer
Belongs to the 2-selenouridine synthase family
Contains 1 rhodanese domain

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: O-phospho-L-serine + 2-oxoglutarate = 3-phosphonooxypyruvate + L-glutamate
Pyridoxal phosphate
Required both in major phosphorylated pathway of serine biosynthesis and in the biosynthesis of pyridoxine (By similarity)
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the class-V pyridoxal-phosphate-dependent aminotransferase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the sfsA family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Required for normal cell growth
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the UPF0033 family. SirA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Belongs to the slyX family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Destroys radicals which are normally produced within the cells and which are toxic to biological systems
2 superoxide + 2 H(+) = O(2) + H(2)O(2)
Binds 1 iron ion per subunit
Homodimer
Belongs to the iron/manganese superoxide dismutase family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Involved in the efflux of sugars. The physiological role may be the reduction of the intracellular concentration of toxic sugars or sugar metabolites
Inner membrane; multi-pass membrane protein
Belongs to the major facilitator superfamily. SotB (TC 2.A.1.2) family

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Catalyzes the biosynthesis of agmatine from arginine
L-arginine = agmatine + CO(2)
Magnesium
Pyridoxal phosphate
Belongs to the Orn/Lys/Arg decarboxylase class-II family. SpeA subfamily

citation.name: Environ. Microbiol.
citation.title: Complete genome sequence and comparative analysis of the metabolically versatile Pseudomonas putida KT2440.

comment.text: Binds 1 zinc ion
Cytoplasm
Belongs to the sprT family
